H0.text: The nervous system is the simple type possessed by cnidarians, used for sensing touch.

H1.text: Circulatory system is the simple type of system used for sensing touch that cnidarians possess.

H2.text: The lymphatic system is the simple type of system used for sensing touch that cnidarians possess.

H3.text: Bacterial system is the simple type of system that cnidarians possess for sensing touch.

A4.text: Most of their bodies are innervated by decentralized nerve nets that control their swimming musculature and connect with sensory structures
